CASHBACK.felt_value: High when payout is near-instant and framed as money-back on everyday spend.
CASHBACK.friction_risk: Very high if claims require multi-step forms or long waits; run sludge audit on receipt flow.
CASHBACK.brand_fit_congruency: Best for utilitarian/considered durables where reassurance matters.
CASHBACK.cadence_strength: Pair with daily/weekly payout messaging so it doesn’t feel like a lottery.
CASHBACK.compliance_risk: Moderate—ensure disclosure of payout timelines;, keep funds trust accounts where required.
copy_moves: Lead with immediacy (“Cash hits 48h after approval”).
Explain proof steps in one breath (“snap receipt, Trudy autovalidates, paid”).
sludge_audit: Auto-parse receipts; avoid manual reviews unless flagged.
Offer PayTo/instant transfer to remove cheque lag.

PRICE_OFF.felt_value: Needs salient threshold (left-digit change, round-dollar drop) to be noticed.
PRICE_OFF.friction_risk: Low (automatic) but easily ignored if discount is small.
PRICE_OFF.brand_fit_congruency: Works for low stockability categories or premium tiers guarding against ‘free’ dilution.
PRICE_OFF.compliance_risk: Low, but ensure was/now claims meet ACCC evidence.
copy_moves: Headline the left-digit break (“Now $49 (was $62)”).
Show reference price anchor when shoppers expect it.

BOGO.felt_value: Zero-price framing (“free pack”) beats equivalent % off for most shoppers.
BOGO.friction_risk: Low if bundle execution is simple; ensure supply can handle stock-up behaviour.
BOGO.brand_fit_congruency: Great for stock-up, sharable, pantry categories. Less so for bulky durables.
BOGO.compliance_risk: Low; watch for unit pricing disclosures.
copy_moves: State bonus quantity (“Buy 2, get 2 free”) vs percentages.
Call out shelf-life cues to encourage multiple unit pickup.

GWP.felt_value: Peaks when premium/gift extends the core benefit (benefit congruency).
GWP.friction_risk: Moderate (fulfilment logistics) but no claim forms if on-pack.
GWP.brand_fit_congruency: Hedonic products → hedonic gifts; durables → accessories/warranty to reduce risk.
GWP.cadence_strength: Feels instantaneous if inventory is on hand; avoid post-campaign shipping if possible.
GWP.compliance_risk: Low; ensure value disclosure for trade promo permits.
copy_moves: Name the exact accessory + RRP (“Bonus $129 steam wand”).
Link gift to use-case (“Perfect fit for your new appliance”).

LOYALTY_STAMP.felt_value: Rises sharply when shoppers see head-start progress and near-term targets.
LOYALTY_STAMP.friction_risk: High if progress is invisible; reduce steps via auto-stamping.
LOYALTY_STAMP.brand_fit_congruency: Great for habitual categories (coffee, QSR, grocery); match reward to purchase cycle.
LOYALTY_STAMP.cadence_strength: Driven by progress cues; show “2 visits left” style prompts.
LOYALTY_STAMP.compliance_risk: Low; data privacy handling must be clear.
copy_moves: Auto-credit the first stamp (“We started you halfway there”).
Display distance-to-reward on POS + email.

INSTANT_WIN.felt_value: High when cadence is dense (hourly/daily) and odds are framed as frequent events.
INSTANT_WIN.brand_fit_congruency: Best when brand wants momentum + repeat visits (FMCG, convenience, liquor).
INSTANT_WIN.cadence_strength: Core lever; set hourly/daily windows tied to claim data.
INSTANT_WIN.compliance_risk: Medium—watch near-miss simulation and AU permit rules.
copy_moves: Say “Winners every hour” vs total winners.
Publish recent winner ticker for social proof.

SCARCITY.felt_value: Limited quantity messages outperform time-based urgency for aspirational items.
SCARCITY.friction_risk: Low—just messaging. Ensure honesty to avoid backlash.
SCARCITY.brand_fit_congruency: Works when prize/product is symbolic or premium; avoid for everyday staples unless stock is real.
SCARCITY.cadence_strength: N/A, but pair with countdown only if supply data supports it.
SCARCITY.compliance_risk: High if scarcity claim is false—document inventory proof.
copy_moves: “Only 300 artisan sets available nationally.”
Tie scarcity to reason (“batch-roasted, limited harvest”).

REFERRAL.felt_value: Two-sided incentives lift participation; align reward type with product positioning.
REFERRAL.friction_risk: Moderate (tracking). Provide instant acknowledgement to both parties.
REFERRAL.brand_fit_congruency: Strong for subscription, finance, telco—segments where referred users have higher LTV.
REFERRAL.cadence_strength: N/A, but send streak/status updates (“1 friend away from VIP tier”).
REFERRAL.compliance_risk: Medium—ensure privacy + spam approvals (especially AU Spam Act).
copy_moves: Spell out both sides (“You and your friend each get $50 credit”).
Use progress meter (“3/5 referrals unlocked”).

BUNDLE.felt_value: Clear complementary fit beats arbitrary bundling; show genuine combined savings.
BUNDLE.friction_risk: Low operationally; risk is shopper suspicion if bundle feels forced.
BUNDLE.brand_fit_congruency: Durables + accessories, or multi-SKU grocery missions.
copy_moves: Explain why bundle matters (“Prep + serve kit so you’re launch-ready”).
Quantify savings (“Save $180 vs buying pieces solo”).

WARRANTY.felt_value: Signals quality and reduces post-purchase risk; especially useful for challenger brands.
WARRANTY.friction_risk: Low when auto-registered; high if buyer must mail forms.
WARRANTY.compliance_risk: Medium—ensure coverage terms meet Australian Consumer Law.
copy_moves: Spell coverage plainly (“3-year total care incl. parts & labour”).
Highlight automatic registration to remove admin fear.

PRICE_THRESHOLD.felt_value: Needs noticeable jump (round-dollar, left-digit); thresholds too tight feel manipulative.
PRICE_THRESHOLD.friction_risk: Low, but shopper needs clarity on qualifying SKUs.
PRICE_THRESHOLD.brand_fit_congruency: Grocery baskets, skincare, specialty retail where trading-up is natural.
PRICE_THRESHOLD.cadence_strength: Immediate reward; emphasise closeness (“Spend $12 more for $20 off”).
PRICE_THRESHOLD.compliance_risk: Low; ensure qualifying SKU list is transparent.
copy_moves: Show progress at POS (“Only $8 short of $20 bonus”).
Use round-number benefit ($20/$50) rather than 17.5%.

REF_COMPLIANCE_AU.compliance_risk: High—Games of chance require permits once prize pool crosses state thresholds (ACT > $3k, SA > $5k, NSW > $10k).
copy_moves: Embed permit ID in footer copy once issued.
Set go-live only after paperwork is confirmed.
